-c70JmtiuVO5jyCf8Wzqfg.text: a couple of guys i went to uni with work around the same area i do, and this place just tends to be right in the middle, I have found the food to be quite nice but a bit to greasy for my liking. i mean the burgers literally drip grease onto the plate. but still we go there now and again, because once you get past that part of the mean its actually rather nice, and sometimes less greasy than others. the venue itself is smart. but they don't let you sit down at a table until all your party has arrived Overall I would only venture here because its convenient.

3aaVzS_KDKFFmV94LVGIZg.text: Tinsel Town? What a great name!! Me and my friends literally stumbled upon this place in our drunken states at five o clock in the morning. We'd come from a party in Old Street and somehow ended up in Farringdon at an American Diner, eating huge burgers and falling asleep in our plates. To be fair I can't remember much about this place, other than it has the typical American Diner appearance and menu. I'm actually, now thinking about it guessing they must do an amazing chocolate cake here and when I'm finished dieting I will definitely go back and check out their deserts. The cool thing about Tinsel Town is nobody knows when it closes  well I'm sure they do- but it's open till such early hours in the morning that ravers never see this place closed. I remember thinking that the burgers were fairly expensive, but I suppose this is the price you pay for wanting American Diner style food at five o clock in the morning with the full restaurant service and all. The only fault with Tinsel Town is it's location, Farringdon isn't necessarily in the thick of all the London action which means it's a trek to get to after a night out and ridiculous to get home from at five in the morning  then I suppose where isn't hard to get home from at these hours?This place is perfect for going to after a big night out and could be cool for a quirky birthday dinner thing. Tinsel Town is a vampire's heaven.

KN3jH32pc-T6aAuIsa5hkQ.text: Great milk shakes is all I can really say, any flavour you can imagine is there they have different flavours of chocolate bars which you can choose from and the best thing about it, is its 24 hours meaning you can go n get a milkshake anytime of the daygreat stuff.

YlplEaCUk7JTthL53rYIgA.text: Place was horrible.  All the burgers come with two beef patties, don't even bother asking them to modify it so you can eat without blowing up afterwards.  Service was rude and slow. Food was forgettable.

Mdu86qFJFX-6tf-XtLUGbg.text: This is an amazing little restaurant of an American diner theme. I don't know many people that have heard of it so i don't think its that big. BUT  if you love milkshakes, this is definitely the place to be. You will have never seen such a menu for milkshakes  every kind of chocolate/sweets made into milkshake favours e.g. twix, m&ms, starburst, lion bar, caramel, crunchie and many many more. They are around £4 but definitely worth it. They do do food as well, of course, American style such as burgers, though they do do some Chinese food aswell but you would go there for the milkshakes rather then the food. It is a little hidden gem located downstairs in the building.

6c6uOi8YR4jI4UKH0UpzgQ.text: The guys at my previous work place raved about this place so I took my girlfriend out to give it a try. The food is crap. I have never tasted a burger so bad. It seems to be the way they prepare the meat, but maybe there is something else they put in it. I know it a Hala restaurant, but so is Burger King in Singapore and they have the best fast food burgers I've ever tasted. The people at Tinsel Town also can't make milkshakes. I wouldn't even go there again if you paid me. To top it all off it's a rip off for what you get.

p4rAl3bdS7O9Fl0eK4gEIQ.text: Juicetastic!Yes, who needs alcohol when you can have a refreshing shot of juice in this wonderful bar where a man can still, in his mind at least, be mistaken for James Bond?

boa370_aV0jNtlRd6BaNmw.text: Best burgers and milkshakes in London! Great vibe especially for a birthday. I normally have the cajun chicken burger and this is always great. The milkshakes are really good - you can literally have any kind of chocolate bar milkshake eg. snickers, mars, maltesers etc. You sometimes have to queue upstairs and they won't let you in unless your whole party is there. The booths are nice especially when you go in a big group. The best thing about this place is that it is open 24 hours. Service is quick and staff are friendly. Would definitely recommend to one and all.

OxQc0Uk5sQNTD7DYNZXv4g.text: best milkshakes in London, perfect for students after a drunken night out!

HcIaqGrH7zuEwCo6dFtHTQ.text: this is a nice place to eat but i think the prices is something they need to look at, defo worth tryin the milkshakes

iOzww6TN8UZUUipLsbZHPg.text: milkshakes ae wicked especial mars shake if u like mars if not the they have a whole different range of chocolates and cakes for u to try as a milkshake.. the food is nice also abit on the pricey side ut worth it fully.. and its 24 hours

MZ5uhox5cuBeuuzE50BVNg.text: This place is close, but yet so far away to what you hope it will be.  A bit odd having bouncers to get into the place but love all of the booths and tables when you get in.  MTV TV screens are everywhere.  The menu is limited at best--I was hoping for a salad but no such luck (nor grilled cheese which would have been a treat) so I ended up with a hotdog that was a weird dried pseudo-sausage thingy with peppered onions.  The burgers looked decent, but nothing to rave about.  Fun concept, but a bit off.  Oh how I miss a good diner!

iOa1ctD4UwjEJgnNHF9MIw.text: The name says it all, Tinseltown American diner open 24 hours...Itdoes what it says on the tin as they say. This place is a fab American style diner that serves American size portions which might not be the best thing for your waistline but what the heck, when In an American Style diner do as the Americans do,, supersize it.. check it out!

1nsON5a935fdTRq3LPyJ0A.text: This place is just awful. We used to always go there after a good night out.Then.one time, we got pancakes that were not cooked! I mean literally, pancake mix coming out of the middle when you cut it.Then..another time, my boyfriend pulled out like a 10 inch hair from the back of his throat while eating a waffle. Waitresses were wearing their hair down, no hairbands! eewwww! Plus, most of them, their english isnt too good, so you spend half your time trying to get them to understand you or you trying to understand them. Real lovers of dining out, do yourselves a favour and go to a real restaurant.

o2eoaCFv8omZKWX2_6tKYw.text: Tinseltown is a 24 hour American style diner in Faringdon. I first went a few years ago with a friend as we were still awake late at night on a weekday in Central London and bored.Tinseltown in Faringdon is down a set of stairs and is a slightly grimy diner style restaurant. The walls are covered in a slightly suspicious number of photos of the owner posing with A-List Hollywood celebs (Indeed, it now has a Hollywood branch).We both had a chocolate bar based milkshake which were good though I regret getting the Mars and not being more adventurous.Not a bad place, particularly if you can't sleep, though I don't know if I would make the trip there during the day.

LNSPLBA9YyZupmKg480c9w.text: I have to admit to eating here when getting back from a late night out and there's nothing else left open, so I am glad Tinsel Town is 24 hours. I've never actually eaten downstairs but the burgers that I've ordered for takeaway come in pretty decent sizes and, at least the ones that I've ordered, have a generous amount of toppings. Whilst waiting for my midnight orders, I noticed that other people were having the milkshakes and with such a long list of options, I couldn't help but be tempted. I'm glad I did because even as pricey as they are, their shakes are utterly amazing! I don't think that their burgers are going to win any awards soon but they hit the spot perfectly after a big night out. The fact that they hire a bouncer is a little strange to me, but given the sorts of people you get when you're open 24 hours, I guess it shouldn't surprise me in the least.

NGxEhoelbd-nu6eGjO4mDA.text: Ive been going to Tinseltown ever since it opened. Being a photographer I work anti social hours as often find myself in London in need of a coffee or a pancake. Tinseltown has a vast menu from just drinks(not alcohol) to fry ups panckakes and Ice cream.Great atmospher with intimate booths and tables. With MTV Music and video channels. Oh and if its your birthday be sure to let them know!

N-XHY7fnmmQx9topk-SX6w.text: They've painted over the 24-hour part on the sign!  About time!  Bastards!  They're still not getting any more stars from me, but at least we can both agree that a business that closes every night isn't in fact a 24 hour business.

6LPr_uBYmPwJNaUW-BtzDg.text: Eaten here a few times before, although not at the Hampstead branch, and I have to say it is an experience at any time of day. The milkshakes are awesome, worth the charge on occasion, and the burgers are doubles as standard- need I say more? Great random place, and close enough to 24/7 as possible

X9O6cuKvWkGYgq3SbyTssg.text: Bad service and overpriced. £15 for a burger, £6 for waffleS. Took 30-40 minutes for our burgers to arrive. This place is HUGELY overrated. Also, £5 for milkshake? Blow it out your *...

cNlzLQkG1CmmW_fwZc91dg.text: A trendy, Up beat wicked 24 Hours American Dinner!! place to hang out with your friends any time of the day or after a great night out!!!! Do the best food ever including Burgers, Chips, Pasta, Steak etc And around 50 different flavor Milkshakes!! 100% rating!!

photos.caption: Photo of Tinseltown - London, United Kingdom

JQmDXC1-5Wp7WXhKty8cjg.text: Overrated, over-hyped and underwhelming. Dont bother, go somewhere else

7zlloPYJEhGDW97hdgGDXw.text: love this place due to there BIG fat burgers and great milkshakes, always a good place to go to after a night out to get something to eat as its 24hr.

OPAFjM2SSW1p8vmYt6ELYg.text: Tinsel Town is the place to go to if you fancy a milkshake as they have the most amazing flavours you could imagine. Personally I prefer the Tinsel Town Hampstead branch (qype.co.uk/place/235561-…) as they use real ice cream in the milkshakes whereas the Farringdon branch uses Mr Whippy type ice cream. Worth a visit late at night when you get the munchies. I haven't tried the food so can't comment on that.

OGB9CVyePfxgIDNyrHe8lw.text: I've been to Tinsel town a few times before and all have been pleasant experiences. Good food. Nice milkshakes and the usual back alley looking clientele. However, Tinseltown seems to have mass employed new waiters, if you can even call them that, from some country in the EU which has open borders with the UK. As a result if you decide to eat at Tinseltown expect your food to be plonked on your table by argumentative, gum chomping, quick to grab your money Tinselswines. Tinseltown should be renamed Fritzltown because it's where decency and manners go to die.One plate plonker decided that he would explain to me over and over again that I had not ordered cheese with my burger and therefore I had to sell my soul to the devil, give him my first born child and pray to Buddha for forgiveness if I was ever to see a slice of cheese on my burger.Be aware of the service charge that they put on the receipt. They know that no-one in their right mind tips a a right royal teacosy. You do not have to pay for the luxury of being on the end on abysmal customer service skills. Also, the plate plonkers will hover around your table like vultures on a carcase as you count your money. However, It has to be said that the entertainment was excellent and mind blowing. I've never seen such skill and precision when it comes to a eating a burger; navigating around a veil draped around the hole in your face.Lastly, the toilets look a smell like pisspits.

7PFUDdGxoBSS0lzx4-PhOw.text: This place has fantastic milkshakes, and you can get them made from almost anything you please, from oreo cookies to ferro roche chocolate, they are gorgeous, albeit a tad pricey! However, over the years there are now many other places selling similar milkshakes, and the quality of the food they server is poor for the price you pay, so I only visit if I am in the local area!

Dnf9tjXbZOOWMLjjqJFePg.text: Very very disapointing. Poor service starters came cold and only just before main course. Burgers soggy. Shakes nice but small for price. Reading the other reviews makes me think this place has changed owners? Tatty decor as wellI would definately say avoid

bSaisb0AfSZDYb_2O0323w.text: Tinsel Town is the sort of place that should be loads of fun but is really just very surreal. Going to the 'American-style diner' late at night means being greeted at the door by bouncers who don't seem to realise they aren't working at one of the nearby Smithfield clubs. You could almost understand where they might be confused, as the restaurant is packed with fussily-dressed club goers, which makes things awkward if you're just looking for a midnight snack. But what's most annoying is that they claim to be open 24 hours, but actually close between 7 and 10am for cleaning. This is especially ridiculous considering they have a breakfast menu. The main attraction of the diner, their milkshakes, are still a nice treat and probably some of the best in London, though they are rather small for the price. If you find yourself with a craving, you'd do better to get to their Hampstead outpost which is still open until 2am.

h8opWXU-5KIHDsRBuLkDPg.text: After my visit last nite my oppinion of Tinsle town has completely changed. The staff were rude and unhelpful and the milkshakes were flavourless!

27joi3zepGGmQGti1wApNg.text: The pubs have closed.All restaurants have long since closed.Even Soho has shut up shop for the night.But you're hungry.Where are you gonna go?You don't really have much choice other than Tinseltown, Farringdon.As it happens, there are worse places to go.At up to £4.50 for a milkshake - and £3.99 for a few strands of pita with humous - it's not cheap - but perhaps you have to pay slightly over the odds for the luxury of having somewhere you can go whenever you want it.The security on the door seems rather odd - and almost off-putting - but once you're inside, the staff are friendly and a cheesy menu (every dish named after something linked to Hollywood) offers you a wide choice of meals - from a whole host of nationalities. The food is functional, but fine.And if it's you're friend's birthday, make sure you let the staff know - they'll get a candle in their dessert and they'll get a special birthday message from Ne-Yo and a whole host of other so-called celebrities who might impress younger, cooler people than me.

0d52pGAXmSUdcqL1vuWMmg.text: a great place to go and have a FUN time out with your friends or have a romantic time out with your boyfriend or girlfriend They have varieties of menu's from drink - delicious mouth watering desserts and it's very hard to choose what to eat because the food is TASTY so the best way is to try different things each time you go there.. Banana Split is the BEST as well as Sundae followed by Waffles.. TinselTown,,,a place you can enjoy :) You can also have b'day message on their plasma screens, with extra payment {only £5}...and get FREE tinseltown oscar award with sundaemmmmmm YUMMY!!

DCiRfXv7r5kFyRS68P-ElQ.text: Want a shake? I mean, a real honest to goodness, stick to your straw thick, candy-bar infused, un-suckable-through a straw, ice cream shake? Then run (don't walk, you'll want to burn the extra calories) immediately to Tinseltown. You could also come here for waffles. Just replace the word shake with waffles in sentence above... erm, kinda. These were legit waffles, ok? Avoid everything else. Thank me later. (After the waffle food coma and cheek-pain from vigorous straw sucking has subsided.)

Wj1uarKXDjK2ca861iDS1Q.text: Tinseltown despite its dingy basement diner appearance has a fairly good vibe, the staff and service is ok, and the food is generally good. They tend to do very good offers on a Monday for a meal for £5, check these offers on Facebook searching Tinseltown Diner. Why I go there is mainly for the milkshakes, they are top notch especially the Oreo Milkshake, no other restaurant does it properly, Tinseltown do, its solid ice cream texture when you arrive, and it tastes great!

yfemcQGYW0KDi4X3vXrI6g.text: I would never come here on an ordinary day, I would never suggest to a group of friends to come here for lunch or dinner or breakfast for that matter.I would only come here after a night out in near by clubs, for instance Fabric or Turnmills.  I think it was specifically aimed at that crowd.  After a long night of dancing and drinking this place offers fuel, greasy fuel to get home and look half decent whilst you travel at 6 in the morning in the tube.  It is the only time I would recommend it.  The string shoes fries are a handy fuel injection and if you are in the mood for a sweet, sugary drinks go for the shakes.I would give it a lower rating but I have to say at that time of the night, or should I say morning, that grubby food is very yummy.

photos.caption: Photo of Tinseltown - London, United Kingdom

NtgcICBHbsBLIIvgYLYqiQ.text: This place sucksI can cook better reallyI had pasta and it was yucky but my friends liked the burgers! they are really expensive and staff are so un-frendly. The cook came out and started to shout "f**K, why are these people come to eat here...its getting busy and i am tired". My friends and I was like "ok".Never ever go here.

photos.caption: Photo of Tinseltown - London, United Kingdom

UTVRNskehgdZq2WMvjMcdg.text: Notable for two things - the range of milkshakes, and the honking great , very greasy burgers. A bit of a laugh, but fine dining it is not.

sKMsAua0jPuvhtOonKXqLw.text: The name says it all, Tinseltown american diner open 24 hours...Itdoes what it says on the tin as they say. This place is a fab American style diner that serves American size portions which might not be the best thing for your waistline but what the heck, when In an American Style diner do as the Americans do,, supersize it.. check it out!

photos.caption: Photo of Tinseltown - London, United Kingdom

jLJmFV0oQihAVEhfsUC0qQ.text: The milkshakes get 4 stars. They're pretty inventive, although inappropriately expensive (£4.75 because it has some Kinder Bueno in it? I don't think so.)The food is budget. I'm talking Captain Birdseye quality beef burgers and the type of seasame seed buns you'd find in the local cornershop with a 6 month shelf life. I'd recommend Byron. You'll pay a similar price, get a beautiful bit of beef (with bacon if you want. Tinseltown is halal only, so not pork here). And Byron milkshakes are much more satisfying (if not a bit more plain)Really disappointed. Waitress plonked down our main course before we had even finished our starter (which was overpowered by a gallon of BBQ sauce). Really inattentive waitress took 15 minutes to take our order in the first place. Yet she brought the bill (with the service charge, ha!) within a minute.Go there for a milkshake. Avoid the food. Go to Byron if you want a bit of both, with better food and extremely attentive service!(I haven't reviewed on this site in years. I was SO disappointed with this place I felt compelled to write about it.)

idujvWKYZYM_ojlNem0z9g.text: I really want to write a detailed review about this place - but I won't, I'll just leave it at this:If you're out late, and willing to spend £10 on a shake and a burger rather than another two watered down whiskey and cokes, go here. End of.

jRwCbJ5Wsnm_A7AxSxhQZQ.text: Really crummy service. They make you wait outside in the cold for a table, and when you finally get in you see there are tons of spots.  The food is below average. I wouldn't recommend it.

fd-_2zdS09SVQPhpX53Fig.text: My milkshake may not bring all the boys to the yard, but Tinseltown's does.

ATKTKcbLqlBlY_CeZ31WQA.text: This place so needs to shape up. Service is so bad here that 'poor' is being generous. They really havn't got a clue as to customer service. Their booth policy is just one thing that needs shaping up. The food is microwave chic. You'd only go willingly if drunk or really have no concept of taste. The milkshakes are the only thing this place has to offer that it could legitimately hang its hat on. But it is by no means the best shake in town. Maybe at 5 in the morning but otherwise there are way better,Do yourself a favour, only consider going here if your drunk or under 15 and need a place to hang.

61rD5CDik814wPR2FhkEWQ.text: I'll start off by saying that traditional British food is terrible. For American students studying/traveling abroad, Tinseltown is a shining star. For a moment, you may actually think you're home. As far as American diners in London, go, I give it three stars. If this same diner was in Philadelphia, I'd give it half of one star. I hope that message resonates with any Britons reading this review. (hint: I tried your diner, now come here and try ours!)I ate here several times during my summer in London. The milkshakes are a little watery by American standards but it's the best you're going to find in London. I appreciated their effort to make me feel at home. Their other desserts seemed adequately American. The chicken fingers look more like french fries than anything else. That was a huge let down but, again, they tried. Oddly, they brewed a kick butt espresso! It left me bouncing off buildings all the way back to my flat on Bowling Green (yeah Islington!). And what's up with the use of salad cream (their take on salad dressing) and brown sauce (supposedly their take on BBQ sauce). Both were readily available in packet form in a plastic cup on the table. Odd. Very odd. This place was perfect for a late-night meal after hitting the pubs. I can't say that I'd go for lunch or dinner (or 100% sober). My favorite lunch spot  is Wagamama - I'll review that next.So, this place is a must try but don't expect to get much out of your visit than the comforting feeling of home.

uWh8PohAIw45Ko0_PSl49Q.text: The food was unforgettable. I will never forget how bad it was, I ordered a burger, it looked like the cow was on a diet. The waitress was walking around like she didn't work there, the fries looked questionable as to where it derived from. I would say if you're drunk just go to a kebab shop. The only reason they get 1 star is the milk shakes are actually really nice.

Uhya1VKB8mSme6lc5MAUMw.text: It's so funny that I come here as an American and eat American food because my British friends are craving American diner food.  It was not bad at all!  It was a little on the pricey side, but many things are pricey here in London!  I love this place overall.  It was a fun and good experience =)..  I came here after clubbing and it was so loud, but it was so much fun just eating here.  I wish I could've stayed longe rin London! ^^

3GbZF_uOmMnWYFPtTFSF7A.text: really liked this place, especially because it was open so late so we went after a night out for burgers. really chilled vibe - almost to the point of grimey but the milkshakes and fries were great

-qFo3kX4PF63Ij3aP6ttHg.text: Awful service, but some of the better diner-esque food in London. A little on the greasy side, but frankly it's nice to see a 24-hour anything in a city that seems to close at around 10PM.The problem is that, no matter when you go, the clientel always manage to make the place unbearable. This place magnetises some of the most loud-mouth idiots this side of...well, any side of London. The milkshakes are divine, though. I love the fererro roche one.

ZTckYP7MNSsJ6kFlb7pemg.text: I love this place! I came here two years ago for the first time and fell in love with their milkshakes! Two years later, I've come back to London and I just HAD to get the milkshake. It's so heavenly. I got the VIP cookies and cream milkshake (forgot the name) but it was reallllly yummy! A bit pricey for the shake but still worth it because it tastes so delicious. My cousin got the banana crumble shake and it was pretty good as well :) I would suggest getting the drinks and sitting in to drink it because when you do take away, they give you less. I will definitely go here again, any chance I can get :)

YAYyGpyDAXG8yJ5b9uLQpg.text: The food is very tasty here and the milkshakes are second to none (very filling), the place could look a bit better it doesn't look very well decorated and the toilets wasn't to the standard I'd expect in a restaurant! But again the food here is great

MapXwJZThOucXaAP6SaBuQ.text: A 24 hour, American diner in the heart of London - who would have thought it?! Great food with a menu ranging from American, Italian, Chinese and Asian cuisine at competitive prices - this is the place you want to be for those casual meals out with the friends you've known forever. Especially considering their specialty is milkshakes of any chocolate bar you desire [I am starting the car as I type this!] What's more, if you go down on a birthday - you get a complimentary cake with your very own 'Oscar' and the plasma screens and speakers boom with a customized 'Happy Birthday' message from A-List Hollywood celebrities - enjoy!

photos.caption: Photo of Tinseltown - London, United Kingdom
Photo of Tinseltown - London, United Kingdom

XW78sy_BFCpgiHK4Ap70aw.text: Only somewhere you would really want to go post night, and with Fabric a short walk away, this is the perfect place to crash and replenish oneself with food.  They do all sorts of burgers, grills, salads, breakfast food, as well as Chinese, Italian and Mexican. Stick with the burgers or the breakfast food I say, like their Full Monty (egg, kosher bacon, beef sausages, mushrooms, tomatoes, fried bried, hash browns, chips and beans). Then you must have one of their Milkshakes. But where to we start as everything is just all too sickly tempting. They don't just have the usual vanilla, strawberry, chocolate flavours, they have cream egg, Ferrero Rocher, peanut butter and banana, Reeces butter cups,  Oreo, Jaffa cakes, apple pie... It's all a bit too much, but has to be tried.

Xquyhp3jwcbkKmxLsqOtkw.text: Although this location was a bit dingy (Farringdon) - it smelled like a basement rave - the french fries and shakes were delicious and just what the doctor ordered after a day of wandering around drinking cocktails. They market themselves as an American style diner, and although I am American I can't say I've ever been into a diner but I imagine this is an accurate recreation!I had a Reese's Peanut Butter Cup Shake and my husband reluctantly ordered a Toffee Crisp Shake after he found out that his beloved Jammie Dodger Shake had been removed from the menu. We were both happy when they arrived and pleased by how delicious they were. This is a real family atmosphere during the afternoon (no idea what it's like at night) but there was a good mix of old and young people. I'd definitely return to Tinseltown for a shake but may try a different location next time.

L2ed-OiZvNtwTT1sxktG-A.text: Horrible place. Good because it's open late but service is bad, food is low quality, and music is shitty. Sitting in their pleather mold colored booth at tinsel town made me want  to starve instead. Even the ketchup and mayo were horrible.

d3Z1J0JnVQWMTvqX-Mon5w.text: I came here only for the shakes. This place was a bit secluded in the town. Seems like a place where teenagers or even college students would go. No liquor is served. Being one who doesn't drink, this place is right up my alley. Very kid friendly. The ambience is very American. Service is a bit slow. Seems like a lot of bikers (bullet bikes) frequent this place because there is a sign that says you will not be served unless you remove your helmet. Helmet + Milkshake = Bad Combination. The strawberry shake was thick and had a tart flavor. I plan on trying the snickers shake when I come back.

photos.caption: Photo of Tinseltown - London, United Kingdom
Photo of Tinseltown - London, United Kingdom. I came here for the shakes!

htWWYR3oRdUPozplTGv3ig.text: Oh my word, I've heard people rave about the milkshakes for like forever, but still never been! This what the song Kelis wrote is all about.. Damn these milkshakes would bring all the boys to the yard lmao! I went for my classic - Ferrero rocher - wow it was phenomenal, so glad I'd stay with tried and trusted favourite! It was totally worth them extra few hours in the gym to work this baby off! Food wise, I so wanted to love it, but blah it was just average.. We got nachos to share and I just had a few bites, it was definitely nothing special. For my main, I was feeling a burger, so got the double cajun chicken burger.. I bit into it and the chicken was still a bit pink.. Definitely not a good sign and wasn't flavoursome at all. The Mexican vegetables I got with it, was more like salsa with.. Well I have no idea, but certainly wasn't what I imagined when I ordered vegetables..If I'm going back, it's probably for a milkshake to take away, let's face it!

photos.caption: Photo of Tinseltown - London, United Kingdom. Ferrero rocher milkshake and I'm speechless
Photo of Tinseltown - London, United Kingdom. Cookies and cream
Photo of Tinseltown - London, United Kingdom. Chocolate milkshake with cream

5ehZ6F9x2xN8rkIRJJzyyQ.text: A colleague chose this venue for his leaving do. He booked a table the day before but when we arrived they didn't have our name in the book. Their excuse was that they thought he meant 1pm the day before, even though he called at 3pm so that would've made no sense. Fortunately it was quiet enough for them to find space for us in one of the booths.The atmosphere was lacking. Photographs of celebrities from a decade ago lined the walls in cheap picture frames, and while there was music it was very quiet (not a bad thing when you want to talk to people). At one point the a siren went off and the speakers started to boom. Celebrities appeared on the screens to wish TinselTown a Happy Birthday - It was far worse than your usual sing-song and seemed to go on forever.The lunch menu is very cheap. A chicken burger is £5 or you can get a double for an extra £1.. This price includes a side dish and sauce. You could order a 4 patty burger challenge which comes with 2 sides and dips for just £12. My burger was ok. Nothing special but then it is cheap so can I really complain?The milkshake - Fruit A-List - was thick. But I really enjoyed it. A strawberry and banana  ice-cream milkshake with strawberry sauce and fruit pieces, topped with whipped cream and rainbow sprinkles. It was more like pudding than a drink but that's what I hoped for.Perhaps 2 stars is a little harsh but it all comes down to expectations. I was hoping for a nice diner, maybe something like All Star Lanes. This was a bit dark and dingy. If you want food similar to McDonalds then you'll be happy, but I really believe it could do much better.

a2_v15fk6ZV26lpYt6KRHw.text: To say this was the worst burger I've ever had is an understatement. They are not hand made as the menu suggests. It's so obvious it was a frozen patty much as I've gotten at Costco before. In fact it tasted like the patty was precooked and kept in a warming tray (like McDonalds). The different styles burgers were all pretty unimpressive with many nothing like you'd find anywhere in the states. And for £9 a burger! I couldn't finish this crap.My friends got the milkshakes and seemed to like them but that doesn't make up for the most pathetic of all burgers. The atmosphere was in a basement, sad and run down. They played this obnoxious birthday video over and over that just showed celebrities with bad music throughout the meal. Otherwise the TVs showed music videos and commercials. At no point did the waiter or staff ask us if we enjoyed our meal. I now know why.

eCEZXLKYQtX-2-pBeXFlvQ.text: My main reason for coming to Tinseltown was to get a milkshake. My colleagues explained this was the spot for such a confection and upon seeing the extensive menu (they have over 50 flavours to choose from) I could easily tell they were right.I admit I made the classic mistake of not realising that less is almost always more. Rather than getting a simple shake - strawberry, peanut butter and banana, Oreo cookie - I plunged into a candy bar filled ice cream disaster that left me feeling ill three sips in. I have since learned my lesson.The sandwiches - burgers, chicken, etc - are sized to the max so bring your appetite. They also do take away so if you want to run with your shake or sandwich (i.e. eat in a closet so no one can see you decimating a day's worth of calories in one go) it's pretty hassle free to do so.

7H94GXsdgBKaJLLXjwWx2g.text: Oh, Tinseltown, the place that never closes. Anyone who lives around here will experience the dread of finding out that nowhere else is open. The milkshakes are like concrete, so thick, you literally cannot use a straw to drink them. This is not a good thing. The fries and burgers on the other hand are halfway decent. It's in a basement and its beyond cheesy, bordering on creepy. Framed celebrities stare out at you from the wall. They also make large groups pay in advance which just ramps up the sketchiness. BUT at least they never close.

C-enQcqNnQZD9KBK32XR5A.text: Very nasty. the place is unclean and unkempt and smells rather off,and the tables are awkwardly placed which is a shame because the place isn't even that small. It gets better towards the back where there are more traditional booths but our table was not cleaned properly even though it hadn't had anyone on it for a while. The waiter was nice though and so was my fererro rocher milkshake which is why I'm giving it 2 instead of 1. But sorry...The food was disgusting. Overpriced and horrible tasting chicken burger and cheap, clearly shop bought chips. I wish they gave you the option of what sauce you want or don't want on your burger because mine had a very bizarre and tangy one that I didn't like and I had to scrape it off. Don't go here except to pick up a milkshake! And even then don't expect anything Creams can't give you.

ixGwZfaTclCZ3Lx4NMpMzg.text: My girlfriend - bless her- is totally in love with this place. Sometimes, I feel she loves Tinseltown more than me, therefore I had high expectations for this all-American Diner.As my girlfriend gleefully skipped down the stairs into this underground "diner", I couldn't help but feel somewhat uneasy. It was dark, dingy and had a funny smell - I felt I was making my way down into a brothel rather than a restaurant.Before I review the food, I must highlight the type of customers this place attracts.........TEENS. Not just any teens, the Loud-Mouthed-I'm-God's-Gift-To-Earth kind of teens. As you sit there shifting through the menu to decide upon what to order, the unbearable noise coming from the TV (MTV I think it's called), the annoying teens and the rude staff all start to get on your nerves.The food is nothing special. I wasn't blown away by the taste, especially considering the price. The portions could be considered generous, but us Brits are catching up to Americans in portion size. The milkshakes are very good, but quite pricey.When you consider the price and atmosphere, it really falls short of my expectations. If you like good milkshakes, then I would recommend it just for that.

Ud-b_ZOw8HOv3vayYrbaaQ.text: Popped by here, after meeting up with a friend for drinks, dinner and catch up. We were both craving dessert and as this was nearby, popped in and as always - it satisfied our sweet tooth. Haven't been to Tinseltown in years and could see that nothing had changed with this place regarding the decor. everything was the same, the service was quite quick considering how busy they were, but this didn't affect the quality of our order as the quality of the milkshakes and desserts was terrific as expected. First time my friend came here and he was pleasantry surprised. If in the area again will definitely pop in.

cPmewRLbSxv1FWL-wgz-Vw.text: been here twice now on two separate occasions. First time i went i ordered food to take away which was nice, but my cheesy chips had melted into my plastic container. So i couldn't really eat them without getting a mouth full of plastic. The second time i went i dined in. The food was ok. Then there was a massive fight between two tables of teenagers, which the security that always stand outside seemed to do nothing about, until i complained. Wasn't the most pleasant dining experience even if it's just for some fast food.

5XjPdhdqI1C__jTL_HkMtw.text: Tinseltown makes some of the best milkshakes in London, and although they're not cheap, they're pretty worth it. I love The Ambassador and Fruit-A-List shakes.

photos.caption: Photo of Tinseltown - London, United Kingdom
Photo of Tinseltown - London, United Kingdom
Photo of Tinseltown - London, United Kingdom

NaifOLaSMwdQIUQIQkS9yQ.text: American diner in London. Great food (it was after a night out so as my grandmother would say "hunger is very good sauce"), a great malt, very friendly staff but you will pay for the experience and possibly have to wait for it as well and queues are a regular thing to get to this basement venue. Fast turnaround which I like.

photos.caption: Photo of Tinseltown - London, United Kingdom

r3OGZN5r9JWWardOTTMnwg.text: Food is great! Chicken wings and their chicken burger always does the trick. Fries are great too. I visited here several times while I studied abroad in London. A little taste of the USA. On top of it all, you can finish with the AMAZING milkshakes.

i-HTdlFbFruRlt2DUekHtQ.text: My first impression isn't good I think the decoration is ugly and the restrooms are the worst going to food my steak was good with fries and mash and a bbq dip. I also had              a delicious strawberry milkshake which was really thick.

jan6WoclblPPKHvUHKeqfA.text: I like the location despite other reviewers. It is easy to find and come on it is Tinseltown. My favourite milkshake is Ferrero Rocher

l155SogHfM_mQfbyQ5SwuQ.text: My favourite Oreo milkshake fix is provided here! It never let's me down!

s5YnkbkUIBz3VmmgrFLVDA.text: I love a bit of novelty food! And nothing beats novelty American diners! Seriously, this is like a dirtier version of The Diner. As my flatmate would say, it's "redic.com" that they don't sell booze or hard shakes, considering they serve food that a drunk or a child would crave.The burger menu is extensive and it's a meat eaters dream. It's a little gloomy in here with no natural light but don't let that fool you into thinking it's romantic. Oh no, far from it. Even more so when it's someones birthday and they have this terrifying happy birthday song and video. Secretly I just jealous that no one planned this for my birthday!So as far as American diners go, this one is nasty, but the kinda nasty I love. That makes you glad you've chosen this venue with friends because it's okay to laugh at yourself for loving something that's so wrong.

vUknqDghweBn8CqVhtCuEg.text: Tinseltown by name, Tinseltown by nature. That nature being garish, overpriced, tacky and okay, a little illicit fun too. When Lizzie G. suggested that we leave the swanky and wanky wine bar we were in and head to a 'really cool American diner' I was like yes! I love kitsch American diners with fries and milkshakes, but much like Mexican food, they do not do diners well here. They can try, but they fail. I should have known by the hazard tape on the stairs that this was just a dive and not a 'dive' in the fun, ironic way.The place was full of teenagers. They had awful, outdated pictures of celebrities on the wall and tv screens showing terrible music videos, I just felt old. Menu is full of 'American' food, which looks bad. They don't even serve booze and trust me, you need it here!Bleagh, no thanks Tinseltown, I'll keep looking for my authentic American diner experience... maybe in America.
